description: NGINX request log analysis dashboard based on ClickHouse + Vector. Including request and time analysis, abnormal request analysis, user analysis, geographic location distribution map, specified interface analysis, and request log details. https://grafana.com/orgs/starsliao/dashboards

panels.title: Average response time of each domain name
Overall QPS of each domain name

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    domain,
    COUNT()
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip}
	GROUP BY domain
  order by COUNT() DESC

panels.title: PV ratio of each domain name

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    domain,
    COUNT(DISTINCT client_ip)
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and  ${server_ip}
	GROUP BY domain
  order by COUNT() DESC

panels.title: The proportion of UV requests by domain name

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    CASE
        WHEN status >= 100 AND status < 200 THEN '1XX'     
        WHEN status >= 200 AND status < 300 THEN '2XX'
        WHEN status >= 300 AND status < 400 THEN '3XX'
        WHEN status >= 400 AND status < 500 THEN '4XX'
        WHEN status >= 500 AND status < 600 THEN '5XX'
        ELSE 'Other'
    END AS status_category,
    COUNT(*) AS count
FROM ${project}
PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain}
GROUP BY 
    status_category
order BY
    status_category

panels.title: HTTP${status} QPS and UV per minute

targets.rawSql:
SELECT `top_path` as TOP_Path,
countIf(status >=400 and status < 500) as 4XX,
countIf(status>=500) as 5XX
FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain}
GROUP BY 
    `top_path`

panels.title: HTTP${status} QPS ratio of each backend
Average HTTP${status} response time of each backend

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
    CASE
        WHEN responsetime >= 0 AND responsetime <= 0.01 THEN '0-10'
        WHEN responsetime > 0.01 AND responsetime <= 0.025 THEN '0-25'
        WHEN responsetime > 0.025 AND responsetime <= 0.05 THEN '1-50'
        WHEN responsetime > 0.05 AND responsetime <= 0.1 THEN '2-100'
        WHEN responsetime > 0.1 AND responsetime <= 0.15 THEN '3-150'
        WHEN responsetime > 0.15 AND responsetime <= 0.2 THEN '4-200'
        WHEN responsetime > 0.2 AND responsetime <= 0.3 THEN '5-300'
        WHEN responsetime > 0.3 AND responsetime <= 0.5 THEN '6-500'
        WHEN responsetime > 0.5 AND responsetime <= 1 THEN '7-1000'
        ELSE 'N-MAX'
    END AS status_category,
    COUNT() AS count
FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status}
GROUP BY 
    time,status_category
order BY
    time,status_category

SELECT
	  request_method, 
    COUNT()
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status}
	GROUP BY request_method
  order by COUNT() DESC

panels.title: Average response time of each NGINX
HTTP${status} hourly PV and UV (last 25 hours)

defaults.noValue: There are no abnormalities in the current period.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  toStartOfMinute(timestamp) as time,
  count() as value,top_path,toString(status) as "state"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and status >= 500
GROUP BY time,status,top_path
ORDER BY time

panels.title: TOP_Path HTTP abnormal status code (accumulated value per minute)

defaults.noValue: There are no abnormalities in the current period.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  toStartOfMinute(timestamp) as time,
  count() as count,path
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and status >= 500
GROUP BY time,path
having count >= 10
ORDER BY time

panels.title: HTTP abnormal status code (same URI accumulated > 10 times per minute)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL 60 SECOND) AS time,toString(status), count(status)  AS HTTP
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and status != 200
	GROUP BY time,status
  order by time

panels.title: Number of non-HTTP200 requests per minute

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL 10 MINUTE) AS time, COUNT() as "app"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and (http_user_agent like '%Java%' OR http_user_agent like '%python%')
	GROUP BY time
  order by time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL 10 MINUTE) AS time, COUNT() as "爬虫"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and (http_user_agent like '%spider%' OR http_user_agent like '%bot%')
	GROUP BY time
  order by time

panels.title: Number of program requests per 10 minutes

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfMinute(timestamp) AS time, top_path
	, countIf(responsetime > 0.5) AS slow_requests
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain}
GROUP BY time, top_path
HAVING slow_requests > 0
ORDER BY time

panels.title: TOP_Path The number of requests that take longer than 500ms per minute

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfMinute(timestamp) AS time, top_path
	, countIf(responsetime > 0.5) AS slow_requests
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain}
GROUP BY time, top_path
HAVING slow_requests > 0
ORDER BY time

panels.title: TOP_Path requests longer than 500ms, proportion of all requests longer than 500ms
Average response time for domain name requests
P90 NGINX processing time is slowest TOP30 (PV>10)
The amount of data returned by TOP_Path per minute
HTTP${status} returns the top 30 data volumes
HTTP${status} User IP Request Volume TOP30
Average HTTP${status} response time and PV in each city in the last minute

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
	  client_device_model, 
    COUNT() AS "count"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_device_model != ''
	GROUP BY client_device_model
  order by COUNT() DESC
	LIMIT 10;

SELECT
	  client_device_brand, 
    COUNT() AS "count"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_device_brand != ''
	GROUP BY client_device_brand
  order by COUNT() DESC
	LIMIT 10;

panels.title: Average HTTP200 response time in each city (QPS>1)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time, upstreamhost, count() / ${cal_interval} AS qps
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}'
	GROUP BY time,upstreamhost
  order by time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time, count() / ${cal_interval} AS qps,'Total'
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}'
	GROUP BY time
  order by time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.99)(responsetime) as P99
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.90)(responsetime) as P90
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.50)(responsetime) as P50
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.75)(responsetime) as P75
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.95)(responsetime) as P95
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,avg(responsetime) as "avg"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT
	  `top_path` as TOP_Path, COUNT() AS PV,avg(response_length) as "avg_return"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_ip = '${cip}'
	GROUP BY `top_path`
  order by COUNT() DESC

SELECT
	  `top_path` as TOP_Path,avg(responsetime) as "status response time"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}' 
	GROUP BY `top_path`

SELECT `top_path` as TOP_Path,
countIf(status >=400 and status < 500) as 4XX,
countIf(status>=500) as 5XX
FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_ip = '${cip}'
GROUP BY 
    `top_path`

SELECT
  toStartOfMinute(timestamp) as time,
  count() as value,toString(status) as "state"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_ip = '${cip}'
GROUP BY time,status
ORDER BY time

panels.title: HTTP status code statistics (accumulated every minute)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT timestamp, status, request_method, domain,path,query,server_ip,upstreamhost,responsetime,upstreamtime,request_length,response_length
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and client_ip = '${cip}' 

order by timestamp desc
limit 100

SELECT
    client_region,client_city
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_ip = '${cip}'
group by client_region,client_city
limit 1

SELECT
    client_os_family
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_ip = '${cip}' and client_os_family != ''
group by client_os_family

SELECT
    count() as count, http_user_agent as UA
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_ip = '${cip}'
	GROUP BY http_user_agent
	order by count desc

SELECT
    COUNT() AS PV, COUNT(DISTINCT `path`) as "URL Count",avg(responsetime) as "avg_resp",sum(response_length) as "recv"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and client_ip = '${cip}'
	GROUP BY client_region,client_city,http_user_agent

panels.title: PV of each UA in the current period of time

defaults.noValue: 未输入分析接口或无数据

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time, upstreamhost, count() / ${cal_interval} AS qps
	FROM ${project}
	WHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
	GROUP BY time,upstreamhost
  order by time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time, count() / ${cal_interval} AS qps,'Total'
	FROM ${project}
	WHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
	GROUP BY time
  order by time

defaults.noValue: 未输入分析接口或无数据

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.99)(responsetime) as P99
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.90)(responsetime) as P90
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.50)(responsetime) as P50
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.75)(responsetime) as P75
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,
  quantileExact(0.95)(responsetime) as P95
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,avg(responsetime) as "avg"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

defaults.noValue: 未输入分析接口或无数据

targets.rawSql:
SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,upstreamhost,avg(responsetime) as rt
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time,upstreamhost
ORDER BY time

SELECT toStartOfInterval(timestamp, INTERVAL ${cal_interval} SECOND) AS time,avg(responsetime) as rt, 'Total'
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Average HTTP${status} response time of each backend

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  toStartOfMinute(timestamp) as time,
  count() as value,toString(status) as "状态"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(time) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
GROUP BY time,status
ORDER BY time

panels.title: HTTP status code statistics (accumulated every minute)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT timestamp, status, request_method, domain,query,server_ip,upstreamhost,responsetime,upstreamtime,request_length,response_length,client_ip,client_city
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'

order by timestamp desc
limit 100

panels.title: [$uri] HTTP${status} request details TOP100 (all charts on this page are related to this interface)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
	  client_ip as "User IP", 
    COUNT() AS PV, avg(responsetime) as "avg_resp_time"
	FROM ${project}
	PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) and ${server_ip} and ${domain} and ${status} and path='${uri}'
	GROUP BY client_ip
  order by PV DESC
	LIMIT 30;

list.definition:
select concat(database, '.', name)
from system.tables
where database = 'apo' and name like 'logs_%'
list.label: project
list.name: project
list.query:
select concat(database, '.', name)
from system.tables
where database = 'apo' and name like 'logs_%'

list.definition:
SELECT
concat(server_ip ,'#server_ip = \'',server_ip,'\'') 
from $project PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) 
group by server_ip
list.label: NGINX
list.name: server_ip
list.query:
SELECT
concat(server_ip ,'#server_ip = \'',server_ip,'\'') 
from $project PREWHERE $__timeFilter(timestamp) 
group by server_ip

list.label: domain
list.name: domain

list.description: HTTP status is associated with most of the graphs
list.label: status
list.name: status
list.query: all : 1=1, 1XX : status >=100 and status <200, 200 : status = 200, 2XX : status >=200 and status <300, 3XX : status >=300 and status <400, 4XX : status >=400 and status <500, 5XX : status >=500 and status <600

list.description: Please select the request URI (the list only shows the top 100 URIs in the time range). If not found, you can directly enter the complete request URI (excluding parameters), such as: /StarsL/api
list.label: url
list.name: uri

list.description: Please select the user IP (the list only displays the top 100 user IPs with the highest number of requests within the time range). If not found, you can directly enter the complete user IP, such as: 123.123.123.123
list.label: Specified user IP analysis
list.name: cip

list.description:
The calculation interval is a parameter used to calculate some indicators (QPS, RT, etc.), and is also the interval of displayed data.
[For example] If the calculation interval is set to 30 seconds, the QPS calculation rule is the total number of requests in 30 seconds/30, and so on. And when displaying, a data point will be generated every 30 seconds to draw a chart.
[Note] If the query time span is long, it is recommended to increase the calculation interval to prevent the generation of a large number of data points, which will cause slow front-end loading.
list.label: interval
list.name: cal_interval

title: NGINX Requeset Log DashBoard StarsL.cn
